message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a cross-layer framework for distributed sensing and estimation in wireless sensor networks, which involves communication, information theory, networking, and machine learning aspects. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes low-complexity myopic sensing-transmission policies for optimizing the trade-off between performance and cost, which involves optimization and machine learning techniques, making cs.MA (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed policies in terms of their performance and complexity, which involves statistical analysis and experimental evaluation, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
